problem.markdown:
Mini Quiz (not graded) - Overview of DHIS2
====
>>We can collect different types of data directly within DHIS 2 (for example, aggregate data or anonymous individual-level data)<< (x) True ( ) False
[explanation] DHIS 2 can collect different types of data directly within the application. This includes aggregate data, event data (anonymous, individual level data) and “tracker” data (identifiable, individual level data). [explanation]
>>We can configure data quality checks by creating user-defined validation rules which check the data that is entered<< (x) True ( ) False
[explanation] Mathematical rules, referred to as validation rules, can be defined by a user in order to check the data that is being entered. This is one of electronic methods checking data quality in DHIS 2 and will be discussed further in other sessions. [explanation]
>>We can define the variables that we are collecting directly through the DHIS2 user-interface<< (x) True ( ) False
[explanation] As mentioned in the demo, it is a key principle of DHIS 2 to allow the user to customize what they are collecting directly through the user-interface. [explanation]
>>The outputs we create can not be given additional descriptions/interpretations directly within DHIS 2<< ( ) True (x) False
[explanation] We can provide all of our outputs with additional descriptions and discuss interpretations directly within DHIS 2. This allows us to give the item more context for when other users are reviewing the information and will be discussed further in the analysis sessions. [explanation]
>>The analyses/outputs that we create can not be shared with other users directly within DHIS 2<< ( ) True (x) False
[explanation] The analyses/outputs that are created can be shared with other users directly within DHIS 2. This will be discussed more in later sessions. [explanation]
problem.p: Mini Quiz (not graded) - Overview of DHIS2
We can collect different types of data directly within DHIS 2 (for example, aggregate data or anonymous individual-level data)

choicegroup.label: We can collect different types of data directly within DHIS 2 (for example, aggregate data or anonymous individual-level data)

div.p: DHIS 2 can collect different types of data directly within the application. This includes aggregate data, event data (anonymous, individual level data) and “tracker” data (identifiable, individual level data).

problem.p: We can configure data quality checks by creating user-defined validation rules which check the data that is entered

choicegroup.label: We can configure data quality checks by creating user-defined validation rules which check the data that is entered

div.p: Mathematical rules, referred to as validation rules, can be defined by a user in order to check the data that is being entered. This is one of electronic methods checking data quality in DHIS 2 and will be discussed further in other sessions.

problem.p: We can define the variables that we are collecting directly through the DHIS2 user-interface

choicegroup.label: We can define the variables that we are collecting directly through the DHIS2 user-interface

div.p: As mentioned in the demo, it is a key principle of DHIS 2 to allow the user to customize what they are collecting directly through the user-interface.

problem.p: The outputs we create can not be given additional descriptions/interpretations directly within DHIS 2

choicegroup.label: The outputs we create can not be given additional descriptions/interpretations directly within DHIS 2

div.p: We can provide all of our outputs with additional descriptions and discuss interpretations directly within DHIS 2. This allows us to give the item more context for when other users are reviewing the information and will be discussed further in the analysis sessions.

problem.p: The analyses/outputs that we create can not be shared with other users directly within DHIS 2

choicegroup.label: The analyses/outputs that we create can not be shared with other users directly within DHIS 2

div.p: The analyses/outputs that are created can be shared with other users directly within DHIS 2. This will be discussed more in later sessions.
